text: We have integrated loqate for some clients for this purpose. Setup was fairly easy

Did you read through this guide? It’s really helpful for most scenarios.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app>
I did, it just doesn’t seem to cover this scenario

I've gotten really close with verifying addresses using the google maps API, but I think my issue is that querySelector is returning null for form fields because it's getting executed before the form is added to the page. If that's the issue, any advice on how to fix it?
If I remember correct for this type, you also need to pass the portal id as a secret.
Will give that a shot. Thanks!
Nevermind, I figured it out. Stupid mistake :upside_down_face:

Hey all, I've been facing an issue with the HubSpot chat popup where, I added the script tag to index file and chat pop up is loaded on the page but when the application redirects to a different url and returns back to the same point the chat pop up doesn't up when returning to the original application after redirect, I've checked the network tab and it seems the scripts are getting loaded in the head. Requesting your assistance here to see what am I missing

Hey!

I have main JS file  in a HubSpot theme that's being loaded with the `require_js` tag. I want to modularize the code there, so I created another `helperValidation.js` file, but I'm getting an error when importing it at the main js no matter how I import it:

1. `const helperValidation = require("./helpers/helperValidation");` -> I get the error: `update-interview-sheet-for-refinance?id=5333511209:313 Uncaught ReferenceError: refinanceIS is not defined` 
2. `import helperValidation from "./helpers/helperValidation";`  -> I get the error: `Uncaught SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module`
Would you please advise?

Thanks!
